intro: Tylophora flexuosa var. tenuissima, commonly known as the slender-leafed tylophora, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its slender, often climbing stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers, which are typically borne in axillary clusters. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal potential, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and traditional herbal practices.
